switches.name: AOTInline
switches.description: Perform method inlining in the AOT compiled native image.

switches.name: AOTTrivialInline
switches.description: Perform trivial method inlining in the AOT compiled native image.

switches.name: AOTVerifyOops
switches.description: Generate verify oop checks in AOT code.

switches.name: APIFunctionPrefix
switches.description: Prefix that is added to the names of API functions.

switches.name: ASMInstructionProfiling
switches.description:
Enables instruction profiling on assembler level. Valid values are a comma separated list of supported instructions. 
Compare with subclasses of Assembler.InstructionCounter.

switches.name: AbortOnBenchmarkCounterOverflow
switches.description: Abort VM with SIGILL if benchmark counters controlled by the (Generic|Timed|Benchmark)DynamicCounters.

switches.name: ActiveProcessorCount
switches.description:
Overwrites the available number of processors provided by the OS. Any value <= 0 means using the processor count from 
the OS.

switches.name: AddAllCharsets
switches.description: Make all hosted charsets available at run time.

switches.name: AddAllFileSystemProviders
switches.description: Make all supported providers returned by FileSystemProvider.installedProviders() available at run time.

switches.name: AdditionalLinkerOptions
switches.description: String which would be appended to the linker call.

switches.name: AggregatedMetricsFile
switches.description:
File to which aggregated metrics are dumped at shutdown. A CSV format is used if the file ends with .csv otherwise a 
more human readable format is used. If not specified, metrics are dumped to the console.

switches.name: AliasArrayTypeFlows
switches.description: Model all array type flows using a unique elements type flow abstraction.

switches.name: AlignedHeapChunkSize
switches.description: The size of an aligned chunk.

switches.name: AllocateInstancePrefetchLines
switches.description: Number of cache lines to load after the object address using prefetch instructions.

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchDistance
switches.description:
Sets the size (in bytes) of the prefetch distance for object allocation. Memory about to be written with the value of 
new objects is prefetched up to this distance starting from the address of the last allocated object. Each Java thread
has its own allocation point.

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchInstr
switches.description:
Sets the prefetch instruction to prefetch ahead of the allocation pointer. Possible values are from 0 to 3. The actual 
instructions behind the values depend on the platform.

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchLines
switches.description: Number of cache lines to load after the array allocation using prefetch instructions.

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchStepSize
switches.description: Sets the step size (in bytes) for sequential prefetch instructions.

switches.name: AllocatePrefetchStyle
switches.description:
Generated code style for prefetch instructions: for 0 or less no prefetch instructions are generated and for 1 or more 
prefetch instructions are introduced after each allocation.

switches.name: AllocationBeforePhysicalMemorySize
switches.description: Bytes that can be allocated before (re-)querying the physical memory size.

switches.name: AllocationProfilingThreshold
switches.description: The minimum size in bytes required for printing an allocation profiling entry.

switches.name: AllocationProfiling
switches.description: Enable runtime profiling of allocation.

switches.name: AllocationSiteSensitiveHeap
switches.description: A context sensitive heap means that each heap allocated object is modeled by using at least the allocation site.

switches.name: AllowFoldMethods
switches.description: Allow MethodTypeFlow to see @Fold methods.

switches.name: AllowIncompleteClasspath
switches.description:
Allow image building with an incomplete class path: report type resolution errors at run time when they are accessed the 
first time, instead of during image building.

switches.name: AllowJRTFileSystem
switches.description:
Enable support for reading Java modules (jimage format) and the jrt:// file system. Requires java.home to be set at 
runtime.

switches.name: AllowVMInspection
switches.description: Enables features that allow the VM to be inspected during runtime.

switches.name: AlwaysInlineIntrinsics
switches.description: Unconditionally inline intrinsics.

switches.name: AlwaysInlineVTableStubs
AnalysisContextSensitivity
switches.description:
Controls the static analysis context sensitivity. Available values: insens (context insensitive analysis), allocsens 
(context insensitive analysis, context insensitive heap, allocation site sensitive heap), _1obj (1 object sensitive
analysis with a context insensitive heap), _2obj1h (2 object sensitive with a 1 context sensitive heap).

switches.name: AnalysisSizeCutoff
switches.description: The maximum size of type and method profiles returned by the static analysis. -1 indicates no limitation.

switches.name: AnalysisStatisticsFile
switches.description: Analysis results statistics file.

switches.name: BenchmarkCounterPrintingCutoff
switches.description: Use a cutoff to print only most significant counters.

switches.name: BenchmarkCountersDumpDynamic
switches.description: Dump dynamic counters.

switches.name: BenchmarkCountersDumpStatic
switches.description: Dump static counters.

switches.name: BenchmarkCountersFile
switches.description:
File to which benchmark counters are dumped. A CSV format is used if the file ends with .csv otherwise a more human 
readable format is used. The fields in the CSV format are: category, group, name, value.

switches.name: BenchmarkDynamicCounters
switches.description: Turn on the benchmark counters. The format of this option is:.

switches.name: BitcodeOptimizations
switches.description: Enable LLVM bitcode optimizations.

switches.name: BootstrapInitializeOnly
switches.description: Do not compile anything on bootstrap but just initialize the compiler.

switches.name: BootstrapTimeout
switches.description: Maximum time in minutes to spend bootstrapping (0 to disable this limit).

switches.name: BootstrapWatchDogCriticalRateRatio
switches.description:
Ratio of the maximum compilation rate below which the bootstrap compilation rate must not fall (0 or less disables 
monitoring).

switches.name: CAPCacheDir
switches.description: Directory where information generated by the CAnnotation Processor are cached.

switches.name: CCompilerOption
switches.description: Provide custom C compiler option used for query code compilation.

switches.name: CCompilerPath
switches.description: Provide custom path to C compiler used for query code compilation and linking.

switches.name: CLibraryPath
switches.description: Search path for C libraries passed to the linker (list of comma-separated directories).

switches.name: CPUFeatures
switches.description:
Comma separated list of CPU features that will be used for image generation. The specific options available are platform 
dependent. For AMD64, SSE and SSE2 are enabled by default. Available features are: CX8, CMOV, FXSR, HT, MMX,
AMD_3DNOW_PREFETCH, SSE3, SSSE3, SSE4A, SSE4_1, SSE4_2, POPCNT, LZCNT, TSC, TSCINV, AVX, AVX2, AES, ERMS, CLMUL, BMI1,
BMI2, RTM, ADX, AVX512F, AVX512DQ, AVX512PF, AVX512ER, AVX512CD, AVX512BW, AVX512VL, SHA, FMA. On AArch64, no features
are enabled by default. Available features are: FP, ASIMD, EVTSTRM, AES, PMULL, SHA1, SHA2, CRC32, LSE, STXR_PREFETCH,
A53MAC.

switches.name: CStandard
switches.description: C standard to use in header files. Possible values are: [C89, C99, C11].

switches.name: CanOmitFrame
CanonicalGraphStringsCheckConstants
switches.description: Exclude virtual nodes when dumping canonical text for graphs.

switches.name: CanonicalGraphStringsExcludeVirtuals
switches.description: Exclude virtual nodes when dumping canonical text for graphs.

switches.name: CanonicalGraphStringsRemoveIdentities
switches.description: Attempts to remove object identity hashes when dumping canonical text for graphs.

switches.name: CheckRecurringCallbackOnNativeToJavaTransition
switches.description: Test whether a thread's recurring callback is pending on each transition from native code to Java.

switches.name: CheckToolchain
switches.description: Check if native-toolchain is known to work with native-image.

switches.name: ClassInitialization
switches.description: A comma-separated list of classes appended with their initialization strategy (':build_time', ':rerun', or ':run_time').

switches.name: Class
switches.description: Class containing the default entry point method. Optional if --shared is used.

switches.name: ClearMetricsAfterBootstrap
switches.description: Clear the debug metrics after bootstrap.

switches.name: CodeAlignment
switches.description: Alignment of AOT and JIT compiled code in bytes.

switches.name: CodeCacheCounters
switches.description: Count accesses to the image and runtime code info table.

switches.name: CodeInfoEncoderCounters
switches.description: Statistics about code and deoptimization information.

switches.name: CodeInfoIndexGranularity
switches.description:
The granularity of the index for looking up code metadata. Should be a power of 2. Larger values make the index smaller, 
but access slower.

switches.name: CollectYoungGenerationSeparately
switches.description: Determines if a full GC collects the young generation separately or together with the old generation.

switches.name: CompilationBailoutAsFailure
switches.description: Treat compilation bailouts like compilation failures.

switches.name: CompilationCountLimit
switches.description: The number of compilations allowed for any method before the VM exits (a value of 0 means there is no limit).

switches.name: CompilationExcludePhases
switches.description: Exclude certain phases from compilation, either unconditionally or with a method filter.

switches.name: CompilationExpirationPeriod
switches.description:
Time limit in seconds before a compilation expires (0 to disable the limit). The compilation alarm will be implicitly 
disabled if assertions are enabled.

switches.name: CompilationFailureAction
switches.description: Specifies the action to take when compilation fails. [Extra help available]

switches.name: CompilationIsolateAddressSpaceSize
switches.description: Size of the reserved address space of each compilation isolate (0: default for new isolates).

switches.name: CompilationWatchDogStackTraceInterval
switches.description: Interval in seconds between a watch dog reporting stack traces for long running compilations.

switches.name: CompilationWatchDogStartDelay
switches.description: Delay in seconds before watch dog monitoring a compilation (0 disables monitoring).

switches.name: CompileGraalWithC1Only
switches.description: In tiered mode compile Graal and JVMCI using optimized first tier code.

switches.name: CompileInIsolates
switches.description:
Activate runtime compilation in separate isolates (enable support during image build with option 
SupportCompileInIsolates).

switches.name: CompilerBackend
switches.description: Backend used by the compiler.

switches.name: CompilerConfiguration
switches.description:
Names the compiler configuration to use. If omitted, the compiler configuration with the highest auto-selection priority 
is used. To see the set of available configurations, supply the value 'help' to this option.

switches.name: ConditionalElimination
ConfigurationFileDirectories
switches.description: Directories directly containing configuration files for dynamic features at runtime.

switches.name: ConfigurationResourceRoots
switches.description: Resource path above configuration resources for dynamic features at runtime.

switches.name: CountWriteBarriers
switches.description: Instrument write barriers with counters.

switches.name: Count
switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which counters are enabled. See the Dump option for the pattern syntax. An empty value 
enables all counters unconditionally.

switches.name: Counters
switches.description:
Comma separated names of counters that are enabled irrespective of the value for Count option. An empty value enables 
all counters unconditionally.

switches.name: CrashAt
switches.description:
Pattern for method(s) that will trigger an exception when compiled. This option exists to test handling compilation 
crashes gracefully. See the MethodFilter option for the pattern syntax. A ':Bailout' suffix will raise a bailout
exception and a ':PermanentBailout' suffix will raise a permanent bailout exception.

switches.name: CustomLD
switches.description: Path to a custom ld binary for LLVM linking.

switches.name: DashboardAll
switches.description:
In the dashboard dump, include all available information about the native image (this takes precedence over more 
specific flags).

switches.name: DashboardBgv
switches.description: Set dashboard to use BGV format for dump.

switches.name: DashboardCode
switches.description: In the dashboard dump, include the breakdown of the code size across different packages.

switches.name: DashboardDump
switches.description: Enable dashboard dumps to the specified file.

switches.name: DashboardHeap
switches.description: In the dashboard dump, include the breakdown of the object sizes in the heap across different classes.

switches.name: DashboardJson
switches.description: Set dashboard to use JSON format for dump.

switches.name: DashboardPointsTo
switches.description: In the dashboard dump, include the information about the points-to analysis.

switches.name: DashboardPretty
switches.description: Set dashboard to use pretty print in JSON format.

switches.name: DeadlockWatchdogExitOnTimeout
switches.description: Exit the image builder VM after printing call stacks.

switches.name: DeadlockWatchdogInterval
switches.description: The interval in minutes between watchdog checks (0 disables the watchdog).

switches.name: DebugInfoSourceCacheRoot
switches.description: Directory under which to create source file cache for Application or GraalVM classes.

switches.name: DebugInfoSourceSearchPath
switches.description: Search path for source files for Application or GraalVM classes (list of comma-separated directories or jar files).

switches.name: DebugStubsAndSnippets
switches.description: Enable debug output for stub code generation and snippet preparation.

switches.name: DeleteLocalSymbols
switches.description: Use linker option to remove all local symbols from image.

switches.name: DeoptALot
DeoptAfterOSR
switches.description:
Deoptimize OSR compiled code when the OSR entry loop is finished if there is no mature profile available for the rest of 
the method.

switches.name: DeoptimizeAll
switches.description: Compiles all methods as deoptimization targets for testing.

switches.name: DetailedAsserts
switches.description: Enable expensive assertions if normal assertions (i.e. -ea or -esa) are enabled.

switches.name: DetectUserDirectoriesInImageHeap
switches.description: When set to true, the image generator verifies that the image heap does not contain a home directory as a substring.

switches.name: DiagnoseDumpLevel
switches.description:
Specify the DumpLevel if CompilationFailureAction#Diagnose is used.See CompilationFailureAction for details. 
file:doc-files/CompilationFailureActionHelp.txt.

switches.name: DisableExplicitGC
switches.description: Ignore calls to System.gc().

switches.name: DisableIntercept
switches.description: Disable intercepting exceptions in debug scopes.

switches.name: DivertParameterReturningMethod
switches.description: Analysis: Detect methods that return one of their parameters and hardwire the parameter straight to the return.

switches.name: DumpHeap
switches.description:
Dump the heap at a specific time during image building.The option accepts a list of comma separated phases, any of: 
after-analysis, before-compilation.

switches.name: DumpLLVMStackMap
switches.description: Dump contents of the generated stackmap to the specified file.

switches.name: DumpOnError
switches.description: Send compiler IR to dump handlers on error.

switches.name: DumpOnPhaseChange
switches.description:
Dump a before and after graph if the named phase changes the graph.%nThe argument is substring matched against the 
simple name of the phase class.

switches.name: DumpPath
switches.description: The directory where various Graal dump files are written.

switches.name: DumpTargetInfo
switches.description: Show native-toolchain information and image-build settings.

switches.name: DumpThreadStacksOnSignal
switches.description: Dumps all thread stacktraces on SIGQUIT/SIGBREAK.

switches.name: Dump
switches.description: Filter pattern for specifying scopes in which dumping is enabled.

switches.name: DumpingErrorsAreFatal
switches.description: Treat any exceptions during dumping as fatal.

switches.name: DuplicateIrreducibleLoops
switches.description: When enabled, some limited amount of duplication will be performed in order compile code containing irreducible loops.

switches.name: DynamicCountersPrintGroupSeparator
switches.description: Use grouping separators for number printing.

switches.name: DynamicProxyConfigurationFiles
switches.description: One or several (comma-separated) paths to JSON files that specify lists of interfaces that define Java proxy classes.

switches.name: DynamicProxyConfigurationResources
switches.description: Resources describing program elements to be made available for reflection (see ProxyConfigurationFiles).

switches.name: DynamicProxyTracing
switches.description: Enable trace logging for dynamic proxy.

switches.name: EagerSnippets
switches.description: Eagerly construct extra snippet info.

switches.name: EmitStringEncodingSubstitutions
switches.description: Emit substitutions for UTF16 and latin1 compression.

switches.name: EnableAllSecurityServices
switches.description: Add all security service classes to the generated image.

switches.name: EnableLoggingFeature
switches.description: Enable the feature that provides support for logging.

switches.name: EnableSecurityServicesFeature
switches.description: Enable the feature that provides support for security services.

switches.name: EnableURLProtocols
switches.description: List of comma separated URL protocols to enable.

switches.name: EnforceMaxRuntimeCompileMethods
switches.description:
Enforce checking of maximum number of methods allowed for runtime compilation. Useful for checking in the gate that the 
number of methods does not go up without a good reason.

switches.name: EntryPointNamePrefix
switches.description: Prefix that is added to the names of entry point methods.

switches.name: EscapeAnalyzeOnly
ExcludeResources
switches.description: Regexp to match names of resources to be excluded from the image.

switches.name: ExhaustiveHeapScan
switches.description: Scan all objects reachable from roots for analysis. By default false.

switches.name: ExitAfterAnalysis
switches.description: Exit after analysis.

switches.name: ExitAfterCAPCache
switches.description: Exit image generation after C Annotation Processor Cache creation.

switches.name: ExitAfterQueryCodeGeneration
switches.description: Output query code for target platform without executing it.

switches.name: ExitAfterRelocatableImageWrite
switches.description: Exit after writing relocatable file.

switches.name: ExitVMOnException
switches.description: Alias for CompilationFailureAction=ExitVM.

switches.name: ExtendedAsserts
switches.description: Enable extended asserts which slow down analysis.

switches.name: FailedLoopExplosionIsFatal
switches.description: Do not bail out but throw an exception on failed loop explosion.

switches.name: FallbackExecutorClasspath
switches.description: Internal option used to specify Classpath for FallbackExecutor.

switches.name: FallbackExecutorJavaArg
switches.description: Internal option used to specify java arguments for FallbackExecutor.

switches.name: FallbackExecutorMainClass
switches.description: Internal option used to specify MainClass for FallbackExecutor.

switches.name: FallbackExecutorRuntimeJavaArg
switches.description: Internal option used to specify runtime java arguments for FallbackExecutor.

switches.name: FallbackExecutorSystemProperty
switches.description: Internal option used to specify system properties for FallbackExecutor.

switches.name: FallbackThreshold
switches.description: Define when fallback-image generation should be used.

switches.name: Features
switches.description: A comma-separated list of fully qualified Feature implementation classes.

switches.name: FoldSecurityManagerGetter
switches.description: Fold SecurityManager getter.

switches.name: ForceDumpGraphsBeforeCompilation
switches.description: Force-dump graphs before compilation.

switches.name: ForceNoROSectionRelocations
switches.description: Use only a writable native image heap (requires ld.gold linker).

switches.name: FullUnroll
GCDebugStartCycle
switches.description: Start tracing compiled GC barriers after N garbage collections (disabled if N <= 0).

switches.name: GatherSafepointStatistics
switches.description: Gather statistics about each safepoint.

switches.name: GenLoopSafepoints
GenerateDebugInfo
switches.description: Insert debug info into the generated native image or library.

switches.name: GeneratePIC
switches.description: Generate position independent code.

switches.name: GenericDynamicCounters
switches.description: Turn on the benchmark counters, and displays the results on VM shutdown.

switches.name: GraalArithmeticStubs
switches.description: Use Graal arithmetic stubs instead of HotSpot stubs where possible.

switches.name: GraalCompileOnly
switches.description:
A filter applied to a method the VM has selected for compilation by Graal. A method not matching the filter is 
redirected to a lower tier compiler. The filter format is the same as for the MethodFilter option.

switches.name: GraphCompressionThreshold
switches.description: Graal graph compression is performed when percent of live nodes falls below this value.

switches.name: GreyToBlackObjRefDemographics
switches.description: Develop demographics of the object references visited.

switches.name: GreyToBlackObjectVisitorDiagnosticHistory
switches.description: Length of GreyToBlackObjectVisitor history for diagnostics. 0 implies no history is kept.

switches.name: GuardPriorities
HeapChunkHeaderPadding
switches.description:
Number of bytes at the beginning of each heap chunk that are not used for payload data, i.e., can be freely used as 
metadata by the heap chunk provider.

switches.name: HeapVerificationFailureIsFatal
switches.description: Failed verification of the heap (if enabled) causes termination.

switches.name: HotSpotDeoptExplicitExceptions
switches.description: Testing only option that forces deopts for exception throws.

switches.name: HotSpotPostOnExceptions
switches.description: Testing only option that forces deopts for exception throws.

switches.name: HotSpotPrintInlining
switches.description: Print inlining optimizations.

switches.name: HybridStaticContext
switches.description: Enable hybrid context for static methods, i.e. uses invocation site as context for static methods.

switches.name: ImageHeapCardMarking
switches.description: Enables card marking for image heap objects, which arranges them in chunks. Automatically enabled when supported.

switches.name: ImageObjectTreeExpandRoots
switches.description: Override the default suppression of specified roots. See: Reports.md.

switches.name: ImageObjectTreeExpandTypes
switches.description: Override the default suppression of specified types. See: Reports.md.

switches.name: ImageObjectTreeSuppressRoots
switches.description: Suppress the expansion of specified roots. See: Reports.md.

switches.name: ImageObjectTreeSuppressTypes
switches.description: Suppress the expansion of specified types. See: Reports.md.

switches.name: ImageSymbolsPrefix
switches.description: Common prefix used by method symbols in image.

switches.name: ImmutableCode
switches.description: Try to avoid emitting code where patching is required.

switches.name: IncludeAllTimeZones
switches.description: When true, all time zones will be pre-initialized in the image.

switches.name: IncludeLLVMDebugInfo
switches.description: Include debugging info in the generated image (for LLVM backend).

switches.name: IncludeNodeSourcePositions
switches.description: Track NodeSourcePositions during runtime-compilation.

switches.name: IncludeResourceBundles
switches.description: Comma separated list of bundles to be included into the image.

switches.name: IncludeResources
switches.description: Regexp to match names of resources to be included in the image.

switches.name: IncludeTimeZones
switches.description: The time zones, in addition to the default zone of the host, that will be pre-initialized in the image.

switches.name: InitialCollectionPolicy
switches.description: The initial garbage collection policy, as a fully-qualified class name (might require quotes or escaping).

switches.name: InlineBeforeAnalysisMaxDepth
switches.description: Maximum depth when inlining.

switches.name: InlineBeforeAnalysis
switches.description: Experimental: Inline methods which folds to constant during parsing before the static analysis.

switches.name: InlineDuringParsingMaxDepth
switches.description: Maximum depth when inlining during bytecode parsing.

switches.name: InlineDuringParsing
switches.description: Inlines trivial methods during bytecode parsing.

switches.name: InlineEverything
InlineIntrinsicsDuringParsing
switches.description: Inlines intrinsic methods during bytecode parsing.

switches.name: InlineMegamorphicCalls
switches.description: Inline calls with megamorphic type profile (i.e., not all types could be recorded).

switches.name: InlineMonomorphicCalls
switches.description: Inline calls with monomorphic type profile.

switches.name: InlinePartialIntrinsicExitDuringParsing
switches.description:
Inlines partial intrinsic exits during bytecode parsing when possible. A partial intrinsic exit is a call within an 
intrinsic to the method being intrinsified and denotes semantics of the original method that the intrinsic does not
support.

switches.name: InlinePolymorphicCalls
switches.description: Inline calls with polymorphic type profile.

switches.name: InlineVTableStubs
Inline
switches.description: Enable inlining.

switches.name: InliningDepthError
switches.description: Maximum inlining depth during partial evaluation before reporting an infinite recursion.

switches.name: InspectServerContentPath
switches.description: Path to the contents of the Inspect web server.

switches.name: InstallExitHandlers
switches.description: Provide java.lang.Terminator exit handlers for executable images.

switches.name: InstallSegfaultHandler
switches.description: Install segfault handler that prints register contents and full Java stacktrace.

switches.name: InterceptBailout
switches.description: Intercept also bailout exceptions.

switches.name: Intrinsify
switches.description: Use compiler intrinsifications.

switches.name: JNIConfigurationFiles
switches.description: Files describing program elements to be made accessible via JNI (for syntax, see ReflectionConfigurationFiles).

switches.name: JNIConfigurationResources
switches.description: Resources describing program elements to be made accessible via JNI (see JNIConfigurationFiles).

switches.name: JNIExportSymbols
switches.description: Export Invocation API symbols.

switches.name: JNIVerboseLookupErrors
switches.description: Report information about known JNI elements when lookup fails.

switches.name: JNI
switches.description: Enable Java Native Interface (JNI) support.

switches.name: LIRDynMoveProfileMethod
switches.description: Enable dynamic move profiling per method.

switches.name: LIROptConstantLoadOptimization
switches.description: Enable constant load optimization.

switches.name: LIROptLSRAEliminateSpillMoves
switches.description: Enable spill move elimination.

switches.name: LIROptLSRAOptimizeSpillPosition
switches.description: Enable spill position optimization.

switches.name: LIROptLSStackSlotAllocator
switches.description: Use linear scan stack slot allocation.

switches.name: LIROptimization
switches.description: Enable LIR level optimiztations.

switches.name: LIRProfileMethods
switches.description: Enables profiling of methods.

switches.name: LIRProfileMoves
switches.description:
Enables profiling of move types on LIR level. Move types are for example stores (register to stack), constant loads 
(constant to register) or copies (register to register).

switches.name: LLVMMaxFunctionsPerBatch
switches.description: Maximum size of batches used for LLVM compilation. 0 means a single batch, 1 means all functions separately.

switches.name: LSRAOptSplitOnly
switches.description: LSRA optimization: Only split but do not reassign.

switches.name: LSRAOptimization
switches.description: Enable LSRA optimization.

switches.name: LargeArrayThreshold
switches.description: The size at or above which an array will be allocated in its own unaligned chunk. 0 implies (AlignedHeapChunkSize / 8).

switches.name: LimitObjectArrayLength
switches.description:
Enable a limit for the number of objects recorded for each type of a type state before disabling heap sensitivity for 
that type. The analysis must be heap sensitive.

switches.name: LinkerRPath
switches.description: Path passed to the linker as the -rpath (list of comma-separated directories).

switches.name: ListMetrics
switches.description:
Lists on the console at VM shutdown the metric names available to the Timers, Counters and MemUseTrackers options. Note 
that this only lists the metrics that were initialized during the VM execution and so will not include metrics for
compiler code that is not executed.

switches.name: LoadExceptionObjectInVM
switches.description:
Use a VM runtime call to load and clear the exception object from the thread at the start of a compiled exception 
handler.

switches.name: LogFile
switches.description:
File to which logging is sent. A %p in the name will be replaced with a string identifying the process, usually the 
process id and %t will be replaced by System.currentTimeMillis(). If the current runtime is in an isolate, then %i will
be replaced by '' otherwise %i is removed. An %I is the same as %i except that the replacement is '@'. Using %o as filename sends logging to System.out whereas %e sends logging to System.err.

switches.name: LogVerbose
switches.description: Enable more verbose log output when available.

switches.name: Log
switches.description: Pattern for specifying scopes in which logging is enabled. See the Dump option for the pattern syntax.

switches.name: LoopHeaderAlignment
switches.description: Alignment in bytes for loop header blocks.

switches.name: LoopPeeling
LoopPredicationMainPath
LoopPredication
LoopUnswitch
MatchExpressions
switches.description: Allow backend to match complex expressions.

switches.name: MaxCallingContextDepth
switches.description: The maximum length of the methods context chains.

switches.name: MaxCallingContextWidth
switches.description:
The maximum number of contexts to record for a method. It only affects the analysis when the max and min calling context 
depth are different.

switches.name: MaxCompilationProblemsPerAction
switches.description:
The maximum number of compilation failures to handle with the action specified by CompilationFailureAction before 
changing to a less verbose action. This does not apply to the ExitVM action.

switches.name: MaxConstantObjectsPerType
switches.description:
The maximum number of constant objects recorded for each type before merging the constants into one unique constant 
object per type. The analysis must be heap sensitive. It has a minimum value of 1.

switches.name: MaxDirectMemorySize
switches.description: Maximum total size of NIO direct-buffer allocations.

switches.name: MaxDuplicationFactor
switches.description: How much duplication can happen because of irreducible loops before bailing out.

switches.name: MaxHeapContextDepth
switches.description:
The maximum length of the context used to model a heap object in addition to the allocation site; used only when 
ContextSensitiveHeap is enabled.

switches.name: MaxHeapContextWidth
switches.description:
The maximum number of contexts to record for a heap object. It only affects the analysis when the max and min calling 
context depth are different.

switches.name: MaxHeapSize
switches.description: The maximum heap size at run-time, in bytes.

switches.name: MaxInvokesInTrivialMethod
switches.description: Maximum number of invokes in a method so that it is considered trivial (for testing only).

switches.name: MaxJavaStackTraceDepth
switches.description: The maximum number of lines in the stack trace for Java exceptions (0 means all).

switches.name: MaxNewSize
switches.description: The maximum size of the young generation at run-time, in bytes.

switches.name: MaxNodesInTrivialLeafMethod
switches.description: Maximum number of nodes in a method so that it is considered trivial, if it does not have any invokes.

switches.name: MaxNodesInTrivialMethod
switches.description: Maximum number of nodes in a method so that it is considered trivial.

switches.name: MaxObjectSetSize
switches.description:
The maximum number of objects recorded for each type of a type state before disabling heap sensitivity for that type. 
The analysis must be heap sensitive. It has a minimum value of 1.

switches.name: MaxReachableTypes
switches.description: Maximum number of types allowed in the image. Used for tests where small number of types is necessary.

switches.name: MaxRuntimeCompileMethods
switches.description: Maximum number of methods allowed for runtime compilation.

switches.name: MaxSurvivorSpaces
switches.description: Maximum number of survivor spaces.

switches.name: MaxUnrolledObjectZeroingStores
switches.description: Define the maximum number of stores for which the loop that zeroes out objects is unrolled.

switches.name: MaximumDesiredSize
switches.description: Maximum desired size of the compiler graph in nodes.

switches.name: MaximumEscapeAnalysisArrayLength
switches.description: The maximum length of an array that will be escape analyzed.

switches.name: MaximumHeapSizePercent
switches.description: The maximum heap size as percent of physical memory.

switches.name: MaximumInliningSize
switches.description: Inlining is explored up to this number of nodes in the graph for each call site.

switches.name: MaximumLoopExplosionCount
switches.description: Max number of loop explosions per method.

switches.name: MaximumRecursiveInlining
switches.description: Maximum level of recursive inlining.

switches.name: MaximumYoungGenerationSizePercent
switches.description: The maximum size of the young generation as a percentage of the maximum heap size.

switches.name: MegamorphicInliningMinMethodProbability
switches.description: Minimum probability for methods to be inlined for megamorphic type profiles.

switches.name: MemUseTrackers
switches.description:
Comma separated names of memory usage trackers that are enabled irrespective of the value for TrackMemUse option. An 
empty value enables all memory usage trackers unconditionally.

switches.name: MethodFilterRootOnly
switches.description: Only check MethodFilter against the root method in the context if true, otherwise check all methods.

switches.name: MethodFilter
switches.description: Pattern for matching methods. The syntax for a pattern is:.

switches.name: MethodInlineBailoutLimit
switches.description: Per-compilation method inlining exploration limit before giving up (use 0 to disable).

switches.name: Method
switches.description: Name of the main entry point method. Optional if --shared is used.

switches.name: MetricsFile
switches.description: File to which metrics are dumped per compilation.

switches.name: MinCallingContextDepth
switches.description: The minimum length of the methods context chains.

switches.name: MinHeapContextDepth
switches.description:
The minimum length of the context used to model a heap object in addition to the allocation site; used only when 
ContextSensitiveHeap is enabled.

switches.name: MinHeapSize
switches.description: The minimum heap size at run-time, in bytes.

switches.name: MinimalBulkZeroingSize
switches.description: If applicable, use bulk zeroing instructions when the zeroing size in bytes exceeds this threshold.

switches.name: MultiThreaded
switches.description: Enable support for threads and and thread-local variables (disable for single-threaded implementation).

switches.name: MustNotSynchronizeWarningsAreFatal
switches.description: Warnings for @MustNotSynchronize annotations are fatal.

switches.name: NDCV
switches.description: Run level for NoDeadCodeVerifyHandler (0 = off, 1 = info, 2 = verbose, 3 = fatal).

switches.name: Name
switches.description: Name of the output file to be generated.

switches.name: NativeArchitecture
switches.description:
Overrides CPUFeatures and uses the native architecture, i.e., the architecture of a machine that builds an image. 
NativeArchitecture takes precedence over CPUFeatures.

switches.name: NativeLinkerOption
switches.description:
Pass the provided raw option that will be appended to the linker command to produce the final binary. The possible 
options are platform specific and passed through without any validation.

switches.name: NeverInline
switches.description: Pattern for disabling inlining of methods during image generation.

switches.name: NewCAPCache
switches.description: Create a C Annotation Processor Cache. Will erase any previous cache at that same location.

switches.name: NodeCounters
switches.description: Counts the number of instances of each node class.

switches.name: NonFatalIdenticalCompilationSnapshots
switches.description:
Number of contiguous identical compiler thread stack traces allowed before the VM exits on the basis of a stuck 
compilation.

switches.name: NumberOfAnalysisThreads
switches.description:
The number of threads to use for analysis during native image generation. The number must be smaller than the 
NumberOfThreads.

switches.name: NumberOfThreads
switches.description: The maximum number of threads to use concurrently during native image generation.

switches.name: ObjdumpExecutables
switches.description:
Comma separated list of candidate GNU objdump executables. If not specified, disassembling via GNU objdump is disabled. 
Otherwise, the first existing executable in the list is used.

switches.name: OmitHotExceptionStacktrace
OptAssumptions
OptConvertDeoptsToGuards
OptDeoptimizationGrouping
OptDevirtualizeInvokesOptimistically
OptEarlyReadElimination
OptEliminateGuards
OptFloatingReads
OptImplicitNullChecks
OptReadElimination
OptScheduleOutOfLoops
Optimize
switches.description: Control native-image code optimizations: 0 - no optimizations, 1 - basic optimizations, 2 - aggressive optimizations.

switches.name: PageSize
switches.description: Define PageSize of a machine that runs the image. The default = 0 (== same as host machine page size).

switches.name: ParseRuntimeOptions
switches.description: Parse and consume standard options and system properties from the command line arguments when the VM is created.

switches.name: PartialEscapeAnalysis
PartialUnroll
Path
switches.description: Directory of the image file to be generated.

switches.name: PeelALot
PercentTimeInIncrementalCollection
switches.description: Percentage of total collection time that should be spent on young generation collections.

switches.name: PreferContainerQuotaForCPUCount
switches.description:
Calculate the container CPU availability based on the value of quotas (if set), when true. Otherwise, use the CPU shares 
value, provided it is less than quota.

switches.name: PreserveFramePointer
switches.description: Saves stack base pointer on the stack on method entry.

switches.name: PrintAOTCompilation
switches.description: Print logging information during compilation.

switches.name: PrintAnalysisCallTree
switches.description: Print analysis call tree, a breadth-first tree reduction of the call graph.

switches.name: PrintAnalysisStatistics
switches.description: Print analysis results statistics.

switches.name: PrintBackendCFG
switches.description: Enable dumping LIR, register allocation and code generation info to the C1Visualizer.

switches.name: PrintBlockMapping
switches.description: Enable dumping CFG built during initial BciBlockMapping.

switches.name: PrintCFG
switches.description: Enable dumping to the C1Visualizer. Enabling this option implies PrintBackendCFG.

switches.name: PrintCanonicalGraphStringFlavor
switches.description:
Choose format used when dumping canonical text for graphs: 0 gives a scheduled graph (better for spotting changes 
involving the schedule) while 1 gives a CFG containing expressions rooted at fixed nodes (better for spotting small
structure differences).

switches.name: PrintCanonicalGraphStrings
switches.description: Enable dumping canonical text from for graphs.

switches.name: PrintClassInitialization
switches.description: Prints class initialization info for all classes detected by analysis.

switches.name: PrintCompilation
switches.description: Print an informational line to the console for each completed compilation.

switches.name: PrintDetailedAllocationProfiling
switches.description: Print detailed information for each allocation site.

switches.name: PrintFeatures
switches.description: Print features-specific information.

switches.name: PrintFlagsWithExtraHelp
switches.description:
Print extra help, if available, based on comma-separated option names. Pass * to show all options that contain extra 
help.

switches.name: PrintFlags
switches.description: Show available options based on comma-separated option-types (allowed categories: User, Expert, Debug).

switches.name: PrintGCSummary
switches.description: Print summary GC information after application main method returns.

switches.name: PrintGCTimeStamps
switches.description: Print a time stamp at each collection, if +PrintGC or +VerboseGC.

switches.name: PrintGCTimes
switches.description: Print the time for each of the phases of each collection, if +VerboseGC.

switches.name: PrintGC
switches.description: Print summary GC information after each collection.

switches.name: PrintGraphFile
switches.description: Setting to true sets PrintGraph=file, setting to false sets PrintGraph=network.

switches.name: PrintGraphHost
switches.description: Host part of the address to which graphs are dumped.

switches.name: PrintGraphPort
switches.description: Port part of the address to which graphs are dumped in binary format.

switches.name: PrintGraphWithSchedule
switches.description: Schedule graphs as they are dumped.

switches.name: PrintGraph
switches.description: Where IdealGraphVisualizer graph dumps triggered by Dump or DumpOnError should be written. [Extra help available]

switches.name: PrintHeapHistogram
switches.description: Print class statistics of native image heap.

switches.name: PrintHeapShape
switches.description: Print the shape of the heap before and after each collection, if +VerboseGC.

switches.name: PrintIRWithLIR
switches.description: Print HIR along side LIR as the latter is generated.

switches.name: PrintImageElementSizes
switches.description: Print the sizes of the elements of the built image.

switches.name: PrintImageHeapPartitionSizes
switches.description: Print the sizes of the native image heap as the image is built.

switches.name: PrintImageObjectTree
switches.description: Print boot image object hierarchy.

switches.name: PrintJNIMethods
switches.description: Print JNI methods added to generated image.

switches.name: PrintLIRWithAssembly
switches.description: Include the LIR as comments with the final assembly.

switches.name: PrintMethodHistogram
switches.description: Print statistics of methods in native image heap.

switches.name: PrintMustNotSynchronizePath
switches.description: Print path for @MustNotSynchronize warnings.

switches.name: PrintMustNotSynchronizeWarnings
switches.description: Print warnings for @MustNotSynchronize annotations.

switches.name: PrintPointsToStatistics
switches.description: Report analysis statistics.

switches.name: PrintProfilingInformation
switches.description: Print profiling information when parsing a method's bytecode.

switches.name: PrintRestrictHeapAccessPath
switches.description: Print path for @RestrictHeapAccess warnings.

switches.name: PrintRestrictHeapAccessWarnings
switches.description: Print warnings for @RestrictHeapAccess annotations.

switches.name: PrintRuntimeCompileMethods
switches.description: Print call tree of methods available for runtime compilation.

switches.name: PrintStaticTruffleBoundaries
switches.description: Print truffle boundaries found during the analysis.

switches.name: PrintSynchronizedAnalysis
switches.description: Print types used for Java synchronization.

switches.name: PrintUninterruptibleCalleeDOTGraph
switches.description: Print (to stderr) a DOT graph of the @Uninterruptible annotations.

switches.name: PrintUniverse
switches.description: Print information about classes, methods, and fields that are present in the native image.

switches.name: ProbabilisticProfiling
switches.description: Control probabilistic profiling on AMD64.

switches.name: ProfileAllocationsContext
switches.description: Control the naming and granularity of the counters when using ProfileAllocations. [Extra help available]

switches.name: ProfileAllocations
switches.description: Enable profiling of allocation sites.

switches.name: ProfileAnalysisOperations
switches.description: Track the progress of the static analysis.

switches.name: ProfileBackedges
switches.description: Emit profiling of backedges.

switches.name: ProfileCompiledMethods
ProfileConstantObjects
switches.description: Track the creation of constant objects.

switches.name: ProfileDeoptimization
switches.description: Print logging information during object file writing.

switches.name: ProfileInvokes
switches.description: Emit profiling of invokes.

switches.name: ProfileMonitors
switches.description: Enable profiling of monitor operations.

switches.name: ProfileSimpleMethods
switches.description: Profile simple methods.

switches.name: QueryCodeDir
switches.description: Directory where query code for target platform should be output.

switches.name: RawConditionalElimination
ReassociateExpressions
switches.description: Re-associate loop invariants and constants.

switches.name: ReduceDCE
switches.description: Disable optional dead code eliminations.

switches.name: ReflectionConfigurationFiles
switches.description:
One or several (comma-separated) paths to JSON files that specify which program elements should be made available via 
reflection.

switches.name: ReflectionConfigurationResources
switches.description: Resources describing program elements to be made available for reflection (see ReflectionConfigurationFiles).

switches.name: ReflectionPluginTracing
switches.description: Enable trace logging for reflection plugins.

switches.name: RegisterPressure
switches.description: Comma separated list of registers that register allocation is limited to.

switches.name: RelaxTypeFlowStateConstraints
switches.description: Allow a type flow state to contain types not compatible with its declared type.

switches.name: RemoveNeverExecutedCode
RemoveSaturatedTypeFlows
switches.description: Enable the type flow saturation analysis performance optimization.

switches.name: RemoveUnusedSymbols
switches.description: Use linker option to prevent unreferenced symbols in image.

switches.name: ReplaceInputsWithConstantsBasedOnStamps
ReportAnalysisForbiddenType
switches.description:
Report error if [:{,}] is discovered during analysis (valid values for UsageKind: 
InHeap, Allocated, Reachable).

switches.name: ReportExceptionStackTraces
switches.description: Show exception stack traces for exceptions during image building.).

switches.name: ReportUnsafeOffsetWarnings
switches.description: Print unsafe operation offset warnings.).

switches.name: ReportUnsupportedElementsAtRuntime
switches.description:
Report usage of unsupported methods and fields at run time when they are accessed the first time, instead of as an error 
during image building.

switches.name: ResourceConfigurationFiles
switches.description: Files describing Java resources to be included in the image.

switches.name: ResourceConfigurationResources
switches.description: Resources describing Java resources to be included in the image.

switches.name: ReturnAfterAnalysis
switches.description: Return after analysis.

switches.name: ReturnSpecialRegs
switches.description:
Return special registers from functions in LLVM bitcode. This may decrease performance if the target doesn't support 
returning multiple values from a function.

switches.name: RuntimeAssertions
switches.description: Enable or disable Java assert statements at run time.

switches.name: RuntimeSystemAssertions
switches.description: Enable or disable Java system assertions at run time.

switches.name: SafepointPromptnessFailureNanos
switches.description: Exit the VM if I can not come to a safepoint in this many nanoseconds. 0 implies forever.

switches.name: SafepointPromptnessWarningNanos
switches.description: Print a warning if I can not come to a safepoint in this many nanoseconds. 0 implies forever.

switches.name: ScanObjectsParallel
switches.description: Object scanning in parallel.

switches.name: SerializationConfigurationFiles
switches.description: One or several (comma-separated) paths to JSON files that specify lists of serialization configurations.

switches.name: SerializationConfigurationResources
switches.description: Resources describing program elements to be made available for serialization (see SerializationConfigurationFiles).

switches.name: SerializationDenyConfigurationFiles
switches.description: One or several (comma-separated) paths to JSON files that specify lists of serialization configurations.

switches.name: SerializationDenyConfigurationResources
switches.description: Resources describing program elements that must not be made available for serialization.

switches.name: ServiceLoaderFeatureExcludeServiceProviders
switches.description: Comma-separated list of service providers that should be excluded.

switches.name: ServiceLoaderFeatureExcludeServices
switches.description: Comma-separated list of services that should be excluded.

switches.name: SharedLibrary
switches.description: Build shared library.

switches.name: ShowConfiguration
switches.description: Writes to the VM log information about the compiler configuration selected.

switches.name: ShowDumpFiles
switches.description: Print the name of each dump file path as it's created.

switches.name: ShowSubstitutionSourceInfo
switches.description:
Controls whether the source position information of snippets and method substitutions are exposed to HotSpot. Can be 
useful when profiling to get more precise position information.

switches.name: SimpleFastInflatedLocking
switches.description: Handle simple cases for inflated monitors in the fast-path.

switches.name: SimpleMethodCalls
switches.description: Maximum number of calls in a simple method.

switches.name: SimpleMethodGraphSize
switches.description: Maximum number of nodes in a graph for a simple method.

switches.name: SimpleMethodIndirectCalls
switches.description: Maximum number of indirect calls in a simple moethod.

switches.name: SmallCompiledLowLevelGraphSize
switches.description: If the previous low-level graph size of the method exceeds the threshold, it is not inlined.

switches.name: SnippetCounters
switches.description: Enable counters for various paths in snippets.

switches.name: SoftRefLRUPolicyMSPerMB
switches.description:
Soft references: this number of milliseconds multiplied by the free heap memory in MByte is the time span for which a 
soft reference will keep its referent alive after its last access.

switches.name: SpawnIsolates
switches.description: Support multiple isolates.

switches.name: SpectrePHTBarriers
switches.description: Select a strategy to mitigate speculative bounds check bypass (aka Spectre-PHT or Spectre V1). [Extra help available]

switches.name: SpectrePHTIndexMasking
switches.description: Mask indices to scope access to allocation size after bounds check.

switches.name: StackRedZoneSize
switches.description:
Size (in bytes) of the red zone reserved at the end of the stack. This stack space can only be used by critical VM code 
and C code, e.g., to report fatal errors.

switches.name: StackSize
switches.description: The size of each thread stack at run-time, in bytes.

switches.name: StackTrace
switches.description: Provide method names for stack traces.

switches.name: StackYellowZoneSize
switches.description:
Size (in bytes) of the yellow zone reserved at the end of the stack. This stack space is reserved for VM use and cannot 
be used by the application.

switches.name: StaticExecutableWithDynamicLibC
switches.description: Builds a statically linked executable with libc dynamically linked.

switches.name: StaticExecutable
switches.description: Build statically linked executable (requires static libc and zlib).

switches.name: StressExplicitExceptionCode
switches.description: Stress the code emitting explicit exception throwing code.

switches.name: StressInvokeWithExceptionNode
switches.description: Stress the code emitting invokes with explicit exception edges.

switches.name: StressTestEarlyReads
switches.description: Stress the code by emitting reads at earliest instead of latest point.

switches.name: StrictQueryCodeCompilation
switches.description: Use strict checks when performing query code compilation.

switches.name: StringIndexOfLimit
switches.description:
String.indexOf invocations will be evaluated at compile time if the receiver is a constant and its length is lower than 
this value.

switches.name: SubstitutionFiles
switches.description: Comma-separated list of file names with declarative substitutions.

switches.name: SubstitutionResources
switches.description: Comma-separated list of resource file names with declarative substitutions.

switches.name: SupportCompileInIsolates
switches.description: Support runtime compilation in separate isolates (enable at runtime with option CompileInIsolates).

switches.name: SupportJsrBytecodes
SupportOSRWithLocks
switches.description:
Support OSR compilations with locks. If DeoptAfterOSR is true we can per definition not have unbalanced enter/exits 
mappings. If DeoptAfterOSR is false insert artificial monitor enters after the OSRStart to have balanced enter/exits in
the graph.

switches.name: SupportRecurringCallback
switches.description: Support a per-thread timer that is called at a specific interval.

switches.name: SuppressStderr
switches.description: Suppress console error output for unittests.

switches.name: SuppressStdout
switches.description: Suppress console normal output for unittests.

switches.name: TargetPlatform
switches.description: Selects native-image compilation target (in - format). Defaults to host's OS-architecture pair.

switches.name: TearDownFailureNanos
switches.description: The number of nanoseconds before tearing down an isolate gives a failure message. 0 implies no message.

switches.name: TearDownWarningNanos
switches.description:
The number of nanoseconds before and between which tearing down an isolate gives a warning message. 0 implies no 
warning.

switches.name: TempDirectory
switches.description:
Directory for temporary files generated during native image generation. If this option is specified, the temporary files 
are not deleted so that you can inspect them after native image generation.

switches.name: ThrowUnsafeOffsetErrors
switches.description: Throw unsafe operation offset errors.).

switches.name: TierABackedgeNotifyFreqLog
switches.description: Backedge notification frequency.

switches.name: TierABackedgeProfileProbabilityLog
switches.description: Backedge profile probability.

switches.name: TierAInvokeInlineeNotifyFreqLog
switches.description: Inlinee invocation notification frequency (-1 means count, but do not notify).

switches.name: TierAInvokeNotifyFreqLog
switches.description: Invocation notification frequency.

switches.name: TierAInvokeProfileProbabilityLog
switches.description: Invocation profile probability.

switches.name: TieredAOT
switches.description: Do profiling and callbacks to tiered runtime.

switches.name: Time
switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which timing is enabled. See the Dump option for the pattern syntax. An empty value 
enables all timers unconditionally.

switches.name: TimedDynamicCounters
switches.description: Turn on the benchmark counters, and displays the results every n milliseconds.

switches.name: Timers
switches.description:
Comma separated names of timers that are enabled irrespective of the value for Time option. An empty value enables all 
timers unconditionally.

switches.name: TraceBytecodeParserLevel
switches.description:
The trace level for the bytecode parser. A value of 1 enables instruction tracing and any greater value emits a frame 
state trace just prior to each instruction trace.Instruction tracing output from multiple compiler threads will be
interleaved so use of this option make most sense for single threaded compilation. The MethodFilter option can be used
to refine tracing to selected methods.

switches.name: TraceClassInitialization
switches.description: Comma-separated list of fully-qualified class names that class initialization is traced for.

switches.name: TraceCodeCache
switches.description: Print logging information for runtime code cache modifications.

switches.name: TraceDeoptimizationDetails
switches.description: Print verbose logging information for every deoptimization.

switches.name: TraceDeoptimization
switches.description: Print logging information for every deoptimization.

switches.name: TraceEscapeAnalysis
TraceExceptionHandlerStub
switches.description: Trace execution of stub used to handle an exception thrown by a callee.

switches.name: TraceHeapChunks
switches.description: Trace heap chunks during collections, if +VerboseGC and +PrintHeapShape.

switches.name: TraceHeapVerification
switches.description: Trace heap verification.

switches.name: TraceInlineDuringParsing
switches.description: Traces inlining performed during bytecode parsing.

switches.name: TraceInliningForStubsAndSnippets
switches.description: Enable inlining decision tracing in stubs and snippets.

switches.name: TraceInlining
switches.description: Enable tracing of inlining decisions.

switches.name: TraceLIRGeneratorLevel
switches.description: The trace level for the LIR generator.

switches.name: TraceLoggingFeature
switches.description: When enabled, logging feature details are printed.

switches.name: TraceMonitorsMethodFilter
switches.description: Trace monitor operations in methods whose fully qualified name contains this substring.

switches.name: TraceMonitorsTypeFilter
switches.description: Trace monitor operations on objects whose type contains this substring.

switches.name: TraceNativeToolUsage
switches.description: Trace all native tool invocations as part of image building.

switches.name: TraceObjectInstantiation
switches.description: Comma-separated list of fully-qualified class names that object instantiation is traced for.

switches.name: TraceObjectPromotion
switches.description: Trace each object promotion (generates significant amounts of output).

switches.name: TraceParserPlugins
switches.description: Traces use of plugins during bytecode parsing.

switches.name: TraceSecurityServices
switches.description: Enable trace logging for the security services feature.

switches.name: TraceServiceLoaderFeature
switches.description: When enabled, each service loader resource and class will be printed out to standard output.

switches.name: TraceStackVerification
switches.description: Trace stack verification.

switches.name: TraceUnwindStub
switches.description: Trace execution of the stub that routes an exception to a handler in the calling frame.

switches.name: TraceVMOperations
switches.description: Trace VMOperation execution.

switches.name: TrackAccessChain
switches.description: Track the callers for methods and accessing methods for fields.

switches.name: TrackInputFlows
switches.description: Track the input for type flows.

switches.name: TrackMemUse
switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which memory use tracking is enabled. See the Dump option for the pattern syntax. An 
empty value enables all memory use trackers unconditionally.

switches.name: TrackNodeInsertion
switches.description: Track source stack trace where a node was inserted into the graph.

switches.name: TrackNodeSourcePosition
switches.description: Track the NodeSourcePosition.

switches.name: TreatRuntimeCodeInfoReferencesAsWeak
switches.description: Determines if references from runtime-compiled code to Java heap objects should be treated as strong or weak.

switches.name: TrivialInliningSize
switches.description: Graphs with less than this number of nodes are trivial and therefore always inlined.

switches.name: TruffleCheckBlackListedMethods
switches.description: Fail if a method known as not suitable for partial evaluation is reachable for runtime compilation.

switches.name: TruffleCheckFrameImplementation
switches.description: Enforce that the Truffle runtime provides the only implementation of Frame.

switches.name: TruffleCheckNeverPartOfCompilation
switches.description: Check that CompilerAsserts.neverPartOfCompilation is not reachable for runtime compilation.

switches.name: TruffleCompilerConfiguration
switches.description: Select a compiler configuration for Truffle compilation (default: use Graal system compiler configuration).

switches.name: TruffleInlineDuringParsing
switches.description: Inline trivial methods in Truffle graphs during native image generation.

switches.name: TruffleMultiThreaded
switches.description: Enable support for Truffle background compilation.

switches.name: TrufflePropagateCompilationErrors
switches.description: Propagate Truffle compilation errors.

switches.name: TrustFinalDefaultFields
switches.description: Determines whether to treat final fields with default values as constant.

switches.name: TypeCheckMaxHints
switches.description:
The maximum number of profiled types that will be used when compiling a profiled type check. Note that 
TypeCheckMinProfileHitProbability also influences whether profiling info is used in compiled type checks.

switches.name: TypeCheckMinProfileHitProbability
switches.description:
If the probability that a type check will hit one the profiled types (up to TypeCheckMaxHints) is below this value, the 
type check will be compiled without profiling info.

switches.name: TypeFlowSaturationCutoff
switches.description: The maximum number of types recorded in a type flow. -1 indicates no limitation.

switches.name: UnresolvedIsError
switches.description: Report unresolved elements as errors.

switches.name: UnsafeAutomaticSubstitutionsLogLevel
switches.description: Unsafe automatic substitutions logging level: Disabled=0, Basic=1, Info=2, Debug=3.).

switches.name: UnsafeOffsetWarningsAreFatal
switches.description: Print unsafe operation offset warnings.).

switches.name: UseBranchesWithin32ByteBoundary
switches.description:
Force branch instructions to align with 32-bytes boundary, to mitigate the jcc erratum. See 
https://www.intel.com/content/dam/support/us/en/documents/processors/mitigations-jump-conditional-code-erratum.pdf for
more details. If not set explicitly, the default value will be determined according to the CPU model.

switches.name: UseCAPCache
switches.description: Indicate the C Annotation Processor to use previously cached native information when generating C Type information.

switches.name: UseCalleeSavedRegisters
switches.description:
Use callee saved registers to reduce spilling for low-frequency calls to stubs (if callee saved registers are supported 
by the architecture).

switches.name: UseCardRememberedSetHeap
switches.description: Use a card remembered set heap for GC.

switches.name: UseCompilationStatistics
switches.description: Enables CompilationStatistics.

switches.name: UseContainerSupport
switches.description: Enable detection and runtime container configuration support.

switches.name: UseDedicatedVMOperationThread
switches.description: Determines if VM operations should be executed in a dedicated thread.

switches.name: UseEncodedGraphs
switches.description:
Encode and decode snippets and substitutions before parsing to test libgraal code path. This option is ignored in the 
context of libgraal.

switches.name: UseExceptionProbability
UseGraalStubs
switches.description: Use Graal-generated stubs for complicated LIR operations instead of embedding all the emitted code.

switches.name: UseLibC
switches.description: Selects the libc implementation to use. Available implementations: glibc, musl, bionic.

switches.name: UseLoopLimitChecks
UseReferenceHandlerThread
switches.description: Populate reference queues in a separate thread rather than after a garbage collection.

switches.name: UseServiceLoaderFeature
switches.description: Automatically register services for run-time lookup using ServiceLoader.

switches.name: UseSnippetGraphCache
switches.description: Use a cache for snippet graphs.

switches.name: UseSnippetTemplateCache
switches.description: Use a LRU cache for snippet templates.

switches.name: UseTrappingNullChecks
switches.description: Use traps for null checks instead of explicit null-checks.

switches.name: UseTypeCheckHints
VerboseGC
switches.description: Print more information about the heap before and after each collection.

switches.name: VerifyBalancedMonitors
switches.description: Emit extra code to dynamically check monitor operations are balanced.

switches.name: VerifyDeoptimizationEntryPoints
switches.description: Verify that all possible deoptimization entry points have been properly compiled and registered in the metadata.

switches.name: VerifyDirtyCardsAfterCollection
switches.description: Verify dirty cards after each collection.

switches.name: VerifyDirtyCardsBeforeCollection
switches.description: Verify dirty cards before each collection.

switches.name: VerifyGraalGraphEdges
switches.description: Perform expensive verification of graph inputs, usages, successors and predecessors.

switches.name: VerifyGraalGraphs
switches.description: Verify graphs often during compilation when assertions are turned on.

switches.name: VerifyGraalPhasesSize
switches.description: Verify before - after relation of the relative, computed, code size of a graph.

switches.name: VerifyHeapAfterCollection
switches.description: Verify the heap after each collection.

switches.name: VerifyHeapAtReturn
switches.description: Perform platform dependent validation of the Java heap at returns.

switches.name: VerifyHeapBeforeCollection
switches.description: Verify the heap before each collection.

switches.name: VerifyHeap
switches.description: Verify the heap before and after each collection.

switches.name: VerifyKillCFGUnusedNodes
switches.description: Verify that there are no new unused nodes when performing killCFG.

switches.name: VerifyNamingConventions
switches.description: Verify naming conventions during image construction.

switches.name: VerifyPhases
VerifyStackAfterCollection
switches.description: Verify stacks after each collection.

switches.name: VerifyStackBeforeCollection
switches.description: Verify stacks before each collection.

switches.name: Verify
switches.description: Pattern for specifying scopes in which logging is enabled. See the Dump option for the pattern syntax.

switches.name: WriteableCodeCache
switches.description: Allocate code cache with write access, allowing inlining of objects.

switches.name: ZapChunks
switches.description: Fill unused memory chunks with a sentinel value.

switches.name: ZapConsumedHeapChunks
switches.description: After use, Fill memory chunks with a sentinel value.

switches.name: ZapProducedHeapChunks
switches.description: Before use, fill memory chunks with a sentinel value.

switches.name: ZapStackOnMethodEntry
switches.description: Default: - (disabled).
